channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What Do Experts Really Know? Embracing the Unknown
item.description: Confidence is a necessary but insufficient factor in long-term investing success. Raising the metaknowledge quotient of the investment team can help protect against the surprises that lurk in left-tail events and remain unknown, until they’re known.

item.title: How Hungary’s prime minister Viktor Orbán used a sprawling media empire to dominate the nation’s democracy
item.description: The government's efforts to control media have buoyed. Hungary spent the most in the whole EU—nearly $4.8 million, on political ads on platforms owned by Meta.

item.title: Investment Manager Selection Is Hotting Up. Are You Ready for the Tough Questions?
item.description: Investment managers are being caught off guard by tougher questions from an increasingly sophisticated allocator market. Are you prepared for your next beauty parade?

item.title: Boar’s Head expands listeria outbreak recall to 7 million more pounds of deli meats made in Virginia
item.description: The new recall includes 71 products made between May 10 and July 29 under the Boar's Head and Old Country brand names.

item.title: Measuring Corporate Impact: The Gold Is in the Details
item.description: Do the products and services of the companies you invest in create negative or positive material outcomes?

item.title: Navajo Nation plans to block federal highways to stop uranium from being transported on its land
item.description: Navajo President Buu Nygren vowed to carry out the plan to enact roadblocks while the tribe develops regulations over the first major shipments of uranium ore through the reservation in years.

item.title: Is Widespread Crypto Adoption Inevitable?
item.description: New technologies always face resistance, but demographic shifts imply there is a fierce tailwind behind crypto adoption, politically, economically, and financially.

item.title: Despite steep 38% tariffs, Stellantis begins EV rollout in Europe under Chinese joint venture
item.description: The vehicles will be sold at 200 locations in Europe by the end of this year, more than doubling to 500 by the end of 2026.

item.title: Book Review: Shocks, Crises, and False Alarms
item.description: Carlsson-Szlezak and Swartz attempt to add fresh thinking on framing macro shocks that may often prove to be false alarms. Any general reader will obtain some key fresh insights with this work, and CFA charterholders will be offered an alternative to the conventional Wall Street approach to macro discussions.

item.title: Secret Service acting director says he is ‘ashamed’ over Trump shooting and blames agency’s ‘failure to challenge our assumptions’
item.description: Ronald Rowe Jr. also testified that he recently visited the shooting site and laid down on the roof of the building where shots were fired in order to evaluate the gunman's line of sight during the shooting in Butler, Pa.
